publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4516 Mr David Davidson: Diabetes Week - 11 to 17 June 2006—That the Parliament notes Diabetes Week 2006 which takes place from 11 to 17 June; welcomes this annual campaign by Diabetes UK which is important in increasing the public’s knowledge of the condition; recognises the hard work of Diabetes UK in providing support for diabetics and their families and congratulates Diabetes UK for its provision of education and support services which have a very positive impact on people who suffer from diabetes and their families; further notes the specific work being done to raise awareness of the impact of diabetes on certain ethnic groups within Scotland, and urges the Scottish Executive to continue to work with bodies such as Diabetes UK to reduce the number of people developing diabetes across the country.

S2M-4516 Diabetes Week - 11 to 17 June 2006 (lodged on 7 June 2006) Sarah Boyack*, Derek Brownlee*, Eleanor Scott*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Stewart Stevenson*, Christine Grahame*, Alex Neil*, Ms Maureen Watt*, Robin Harper*, Margaret Mitchell*, John Scott*, Bruce Crawford*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Rob Gibson*, Mike Pringle*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Murray Tosh*, Fergus Ewing*, Murdo Fraser*, Tricia Marwick*, Elaine Smith*, Mr Charlie Gordon*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, David McLetchie*, Marlyn Glen*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Trish Godman*, Shiona Baird*, Richard Lochhead*, Mr Bruce McFee*, Frances Curran*, Mr Mark Ruskell*, Brian Adam*, Margaret Jamieson*, Kate Maclean*, Dave Petrie*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Bill Butler*, Chris Ballance*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Alex Fergusson*

S2M-4516 Mr David Davidson: Diabetes Week - 11 to 17 June 2006—That the Parliament notes Diabetes Week 2006 which takes place from 11 to 17 June; welcomes this annual campaign by Diabetes UK which is important in increasing the public’s knowledge of the condition; recognises the hard work of Diabetes UK in providing support for diabetics and their families and congratulates Diabetes UK for its provision of education and support services which have a very positive impact on people who suffer from diabetes and their families; further notes the specific work being done to raise awareness of the impact of diabetes on certain ethnic groups within Scotland, and urges the Scottish Executive to continue to work with bodies such as Diabetes UK to reduce the number of people developing diabetes across the country. Supported by: Sarah Boyack, Derek Brownlee, Eleanor Scott, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Stewart Stevenson, Christine Grahame, Alex Neil, Ms Maureen Watt, Robin Harper, Margaret Mitchell, John Scott, Bruce Crawford, Mrs Nanette Milne, Rob Gibson, Mike Pringle, Mr Jamie Stone, Murray Tosh, Fergus Ewing, Murdo Fraser, Tricia Marwick, Elaine Smith, Mr Charlie Gordon, Mr Stewart Maxwell, David McLetchie, Marlyn Glen, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Trish Godman, Shiona Baird, Richard Lochhead, Mr Bruce McFee, Frances Curran, Mr Mark Ruskell, Brian Adam, Margaret Jamieson, Kate Maclean, Dave Petrie, Roseanna Cunningham, Bill Butler, Chris Ballance, Mr Adam Ingram, Alex Fergusson, Nora Radcliffe*, Phil Gallie*
S2M-4516 Diabetes Week - 11 to 17 June 2006 (lodged on 7 June 2006) Scott Barrie*
S2M-4516 Diabetes Week - 11 to 17 June 2006 (lodged on 7 June 2006) Cathie Craigie*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-4516 Diabetes Week - 11 to 17 June 2006 (lodged on 7 June 2006) Irene Oldfather*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Karen Whitefield*
S2M-4516 Diabetes Week - 11 to 17 June 2006 (lodged on 7 June 2006) John Swinburne*
S2M-4516 Diabetes Week - 11 to 17 June 2006 (lodged on 7 June 2006) Linda Fabiani*
